Reviews.Title: the real clock speed is......
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am wondering if the reviewer who gave the one star is knowledgeable at all about computers. I design them and I have to say the low power cpu, 15 w compared to one using much more translates into long battery life. Face it if you just use a base number and say it is terrible, you dont understand that the cpu speed scales with need. most time in a computer the cpu does little and its response is not required to be fast for those tasks as it is wasting power. this cpu can run from 1.8 to over 3 ghz depending on the need and allowing lower power consumption. The new Haswell processor also has a number of features that make it more efficient at lower speed meaning to accomplish a task it does not need to run as fast as an older processor to do the same work. Maybe the person giving only one star works for apple, or maybe is just computer illiterate but either way it is saddening to see ranting rather than facts in reviews.

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming, but A bit lacking for the price. (PLEASE read this if you want to play games.)
Reviews.Author: Dillon Welch
Reviews.Content: This is more or less a first impressions review. I've put it through its paces, and I feel I can accurately review its performance. The review may change if the laptop falls to pieces over the next few months.I'm perfectly happy with this laptop, and if the price I had paid for it ($750 used including a gift card) been the standard price, or $50 more, I would give it 5 stars. Unfortunately, for close to $1000 new, it is lacking a lot of features for a laptop of its price. Its hard drive is slow (which i'll fix with a hybrid drive,) the keyboard is not backlit (which should be a standard feature in my opinion,) and the wireless card is not dual-band (and I KNOW you can get those cheap. I bought an intel card WITH bluetooth AND dual band wifi for $25 for a friend, here on amazon.)But on the other hand, the performance and touchscreen almost make up for it. It games great (for reference: plays Bioshock Infinite on medium or high depending on if your want 60 FPS or not,) and is otherwise speedy at everyday tasks.A note for the gamers: I had trouble playing games initially (games defaulting to VERY low settings,) and I found out that the computer also has integrated Intel graphics in the CPU as well as the Nvidia GPU. The Nvidia control panel defaults to the intel graphics (good for most things that aren't video games,) and is supposed to switch automatically to the Nvidia chip when it needs it, but it never does. You have to open the control panel, go to 3D settings, and either set up a rule for every game/program you have, or do what I did, and set the default to the "High performance NVIDIA Processor." This will probably take a toll on your battery life, but so far, my battery still lasts at least 4 hours when I'm not playing games. I also recommend going to the Nvidia website and installing the GeForce Experience program immediately. It does a good job of changing settings for games to get the most out of them, and in my case, fixed the driver updater, which was broken on my computer.Along with that, I find the touchscreen functions vital to the Windows 8 experience. being able to swipe the edge of the screen to swap between active apps/windows is very useful, along with the multi-touch functions of the touchpad (mainly the 3-finger swipe down to minimize all windows.)So all in all, this laptop is AMAZING for the price I bought it, but they are using the touchscreen as a marketing gimmick to jack up the price. If you want this laptop but you don't feel like wasting your money, BUY IT USED from one of the Amazon Warehouse resellers. I bought a "used-very good" one, and it arrived in all but brand new condition. I bought one that had "all original accessories" and came in the original box, but the accessories were a user manual and a hand-sized microfiber cloth, so you could probably get away with one of the repackaged ones with just the AC adapter, which would bring the price below $800.Oh, and ONE LAST THING: This thing puts out an incredibly small amount of heat! My last laptop was a gaming one from about 4 years ago, and was on about the same performance level as this laptop. This laptop gets "mildly warm" when I play games, as apposed to my old one, which PHYSICALLY HURT you when you put your hand over the exit vent (as in, you can't hold your hand there for more than a few seconds or else you start cooking your fingers.) It puts out an insanely small amount of heat in my opinion, and has hardly risen above the ambient room temperature until I load up a game (which you will definitely need a cooling pad for.)

Reviews.Title: Thoroughly impressed!
Reviews.Author: G. Shia
Reviews.Content: Excellent hardware, speedy performance, amazing battery life! The new intel chip (4th gen) does this machine justice. Only weak point is the sound output underwhelms.

Reviews.Title: Cant go wrong !
Reviews.Author: Plume
Reviews.Content: I love it . Great buy, plain and simple ! A bit heavy, and could use faster rpm hard drive, but other than that. No regrets

Reviews.Title: A Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn Bryant
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop. It took me weeks to choose a laptop to replace my dead one, and I am so glad I chose this one. The cons I saw on the other online reviews mostly talked about crappy speakers, that it's heavy, and the keys aren't backlit. I didn't care about any of these things, so I bought it anyway. The non-lit keys are not even an issue for me, so that ceased to be a con. The speakers are more then sufficient (and I paid extra for my first laptop to have superior speakers. So far these seem equal to those.) so that becomes a pro. Then as far as the weight goes, I don't think it's heavy at all. I carry it to class with me either in my backpack or my laptop case, and it is a non issue. Is it "light"? Probably not, but it's certainly not heavy. The most difficulty I have had is with the Windows 8 OS, but I'm getting used to it. It's not as different as it seems. The touch screen is a godsend with Windows 8, though. It's so intuitive, but it also works fine if you don't use it. You will have full operating capabilities either way, but it's way easier to have the touch screen there. The battery life is awesome too. It can easily last me through my classes. I'd been using it unplugged for about 3 or 4 hours, and it's been sleeping unplugged for about 9, and I still have over an hour left, while I'm multitasking. It's worth the money!

Reviews.Title: really nice but not perfect
Reviews.Author: kc
Reviews.Content: very good computer. the processor is nice and setting the gpu to certain programs it's helpful for battery life.the Wi-Fi seems unreliable to me and doesn't perform well enough for my online game. asus Windows 8 recovery is terrible and causes half my difficulty

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop!!
Reviews.Author: Eric Esposito
Reviews.Content: I have only had this for about a week now, but so far it is great. The touch screen is a must if you are going to have Windows 8 operating system. The graphics are good and the speed is excellent. I am not much for gaming, but my son is and he put a couple games on here and they are smooth and clear. This is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Fast, functional, and capable.
Reviews.Author: W. Quayle
Reviews.Content: The first one I received had faulty wireless.  I expect the wireless antenna was disconnected from the connector as the adapter worked but was very sporadic in being able to connect.  Having disassembled many laptops, I know the wireless antenna connector is very touchy, and not having it connected securely would likely cause this kind of an issue.  In any case, I returned the defective one for a new one, and am writing this review using that one right now.Let's get a few facts straight.  Having read the other reviews...  It absolutely is a touch screen, and the screen works flawlessly.The 5400 RPM disk may be governing the overall "snappiness" of the machine, but the CPU is a 3rd generation i7 with a max speed of 3.8GHz.  It will throttle down to 1.8GHz *when.it.is.not.being.fully.utilized*:  Version: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4500U CPU @ 1.80GHz  Voltage: 1.2 V  External Clock: 100 MHz  Max Speed: 3800 MHz  Current Speed: 1800 MHzThe 8Gb of RAM is furnished in two 4Gb DDR3 1600 MHz SODIMM, with maximum RAM of 32Gb using 4 x 8Gb SODIMM.As I have little use for Windows, I opted to reload the laptop with Linux Mint Petra 64-bit, and found the installation and configuration to be absolutely turnkey.  The wired and wireless networking is flawless, as is the dual-screen capabilities, as I am using an Asus VS247 connected via the HDMI as my second display.  I've just done some scanning using my Epson perfection v700 photo scanner, and have found that a 4800 DPI large format transparency scan completes in less than 3 minutes.  These scans were taking upwards of 12 minutes each on my old desktop, so this is a vast improvement and very portable to boot!I am absolutely delighted with the V551LB-DB71T, and have only taken away 1 star due to the defective initial unit.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: Every aspect very very impressive.  Won't find a better computer on the market.The only downside is that the screen is bright, but not super bright.  But could be all touchscreen computers i'm not sure.Loving every minute with it

Reviews.Title: old-school user friendly
Reviews.Author: Carol Williams
Reviews.Content: a little heavy for carting around, but love the keyboard feel and the speed, also the screen format options. i always thought i should stick to big-name brands and much preferred old-style mouse-n-keyboard...but this lil lappie is very comfortable even for an old puter curmudgeon like me.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Device. Thumbs and Toes up for Asus.
Reviews.Author: Luis E. Varela "LouieVarela"
Reviews.Content: Thank you all who answered my questions. There was an issue with the first laptop they sent me, the camera didn't work. My first reaction was get in touch with Asus and try to fix it, since I thought it was a missing driver. But after several attempts we came to the conclusion it was hardware malfunction. I, then, wrote to Amazon and amazingly as always they sent me a new one right away. I have already sent my old one back and I have been working in this new one for days and it's fantastic. I am not a computer literate, but features I like are based on: the looks (since it so slim and yet it has an optical drive), the touchscreen, the keyboard (I work a lot with numbers and the numeral pad was a must for me, plus keys are really easy and comfortable) the trackpad (I was not quite sure it would work as the one on the Macs, but now I know better, and if you are not a big fan of smart gestures, it's way easy to change the settings and keep it as a regular trackpad). Speaking of performance is not something i would feel confident to comment, I will only say it is really fast. I have never been a real fan of windows but I'm getting to like this new concept the 8 has thrown out there (8.1 since yesterday, but I have not had time to play around with it).Completely satisfied with my purchase. And those out there not wanting to be a part of the apple herd, buying Apple products just because, (I don't mean any disrespect, I am writing from my iPad, it's just that sometimes we buy something because almost everyone else does, without doing any research or weighing our options), this is a laptop, shoulder to shoulder with the Apple Laptop (even with some additional features not offered on the Mac) and for half of the price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Within 2 weeks the computer would not power on.  Sent to ASUS for repair.  Came back in 2 weeks.  2 weeks later, same issue.  Now on hold for the past 18 minutes waiting to speak to a human.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, power and ease.
Reviews.Author: RR_KC
Reviews.Content: This notebook offers tremendous specs...is very comfortable to use...and I am thrilled with it! Replaces my old desktop. I also use Stardock to return this homescreen to Win XP 7 like useage. Understand win 8.1 may be corrects this.

Reviews.Title: Last Year's Model
Reviews.Author: Daniel Jordan Griffith
Reviews.Content: I feel doped.Mouse issues.I went to a store, found the computer i wanted, ordered it online, i got this one... Last years model.the return kicked back to me.to late to return it now.Sad day.

Reviews.Title: very good laptop!
Reviews.Author: Riad Abou fakhr
Reviews.Content: i have not tested it potential, but is a good pc, fast, perfect response to the touch screen, great for  multimedia

Reviews.Title: New ASUS touchscreen laptop
Reviews.Author: Madeleine Provost
Reviews.Content: It was recommended by someone whom I trust, who is more knowledgeable about the latest technology and I have been very pleased so far.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: John L Mullins
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised and is very fast. Love the touch screen. Just need to offer office with this product to make it complete

Reviews.Title: my portable work station with style
Reviews.Author: new1986
Reviews.Content: everything perfect expect:screen quality not the best - sucks if you hook up to full hd tvthinking about replacing the hard drive to a solid state for max performance

Reviews.Title: Pleased with model, but not service.
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: It's a very good laptop, and it's probably one of the best ones you can buy, but I got mine broken and glitchy and instead of replacing it they refunded it minus 200$ processing charges; so I'd buy it from someone else if you were to get it, honestly.

Reviews.Title: Solid Upgrade from an Old Desktop
Reviews.Author: Captain Jack
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but this is definitely a solid laptop.  The performance is great and was just what I was looking for to replace my old desktop.  The only issue I've had is a driver issue with the video card that sometimes prevents the HDMI output from having sound.  It's not something I've had an issue with a lot, but I couldn't fix it just with a driver update.  I do wish I had a backlit keyboard, but that's not something you typically see in a laptop around this cost.  As other reviews mention, the speakers are not the best, but that may or may not be important for you.  I have it set up in dock connected to some external speakers most of the time so that's not an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Everything I needed
Reviews.Author: John Collins
Reviews.Content: Very fast great graphics and lighter than I expected. Touch screen is very convenient and useful.  Best quality for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: Quit working after a week!
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: After having this laptop for only a week, the computer failed to power on.  I contacted ASUS for repairs and they had me ship it back to them.  However, after three weeks, I still have not received the computer back. Beginning to wonder why I paid so much for this to have it only a week and then not be able to use it!

Reviews.Title: Poor spare part availability. Cannot find a batterry.
Reviews.Author: Oumar Doucoure
Reviews.Content: I am running into a battery problem for this laptop. It has less than 3 months, but the batterry is falling to charge. I am looking for a replacement. But I cannot find the right battery for it.

Reviews.Title: Sleek 15W CPU - i7-4500U 1.8/3(Turbo) GHz speed
Reviews.Author: VKA
Reviews.Content: Low power CPU's are usually more expensive and have lower speed. Most of MacBook Air use these family of CPUs.If you want higher speeds, then it will overheat like an oven where you can fry an egg.So, choice is yours. I prefer low power CPUs. Now they are able to make up to 2GHZ and 3GHz in turbo mode based on current available technology.

Reviews.Title: Screen cracks and touch screen stops responding a little over a month after purchase!
Reviews.Author: J. F. Stepnowski "JFS in IL"
Reviews.Content: Of course, being able to return to Amazon expired a mere week before this happened!  Laptop closed - when reopened several cracks in screen ad touch screen not responding. What the ##@)$#?(*&^%!!!!

Reviews.Title: wireless sucks
Reviews.Author: TLS
Reviews.Content: The wireless network card is crap. I've had nothing but trouble with it since I got the laptop. I am so disappointed. I wish I had bought something else. Should've bought a Dell...

Reviews.Title: Nice computer, lousy operation system
Reviews.Author: andreina yulis
Reviews.Content: I've had this computer for almost 4 month. It would be a really good computer, but Windows 8 makes it impossible to work with. Every app that comes installed works around a single Microsoft password, and if you have an account with other mail like gmail, it would be a hugh pain. I had to stop working with skype, because it used my messenger account and not the one that I actually use. So had to uninstalled it and install other version.For some reason the touchpad is incompatible with Win8 too, so the cursor disappears and I have to restart the notebook to make it appear again.The computer feels solid, it is not light, but for the size it is not a notebook to be carrying around.Touchscreen works fine but it is not really necessary. My baby girl enjoys it because then she has access to the computer too.

Reviews.Title: keyboard stopped working
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: in computer science classes and they keyboard doesnt work after 2 weeks. Nothing spilled on it just stopped. Now i lug around another keyboard for a brand new lap top....ghetto.past time for amazon to take it backneed it for school so cant send it to asusasked asus if i did if there was anyway i could get a replacement b/c of being in classes they said no it would have to be fixedpoor form asus

Reviews.Title: Windows 8, no!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought this because my husband wanted a touch screen laptop. Unfortunately, Windows 8 is a horrible operating system and makes us want to cry. The hardware itself is fine - another quality ASUS product - but the horror that is Windows 8 makes this laptop a punishment to work with.

Reviews.Title: It's not touchscreen
Reviews.Author: Gabe Cohen
Reviews.Content: The title says touch screen but my laptop is not. I don't care for touch screen in the first place but just so people know, there is no touch screen.

Reviews.Title: immediate malware
Reviews.Author: dc
Reviews.Content: Within a half hour from opening the box, malware rendered the computer useless.  The manufacturer should have set security settings higher on default.  Returned the item.  Waste of time.  Got an Apple.

Reviews.Title: No VGA+HDMI combo --> can't have dual external displays?
Reviews.Author: Gordon Finlay
Reviews.Content: No VGA port? It has just the one HDMI port and I think this means it is impossible to have an extended desktop on dual external monitors? If this is the case, this is a show stopper in my opinion as I work with dual monitors while docked at work.

Reviews.Title: garbage
Reviews.Author: Preston Liddell
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awfulIf I could rate it as 0 stars, thats what it would get. Computer is slow!  Whatever processing power was supposed to be gained by having 8gb ram over 4 is easily lost in operating the touch screen.  The computer is very sluggish switching in out of windows and the internet browser has crashed twice within 30 mins of operation; My inet speed is 30mbps. I'm boxing it back up as we speak. It looks impressive because its sleek and solidly built, but for $1100 someone should be prosecuted for selling this thing.Bottomline:  awful, not even as a $200 tablet purchase could you justify buying this cpu. Sidenote: does have amazing built in speakers tho :/  (but awful as a cpu)

Reviews.Title: weak
Reviews.Author: William B. Green
Reviews.Content: Why would you spend that much for a computer with a 1.8 processor....5400 hard drive....slow stuff...$$$too much you can find much faster machines ...for the same price...unless you just want a fashion statement ...buy a MAC if you need to throw money away.
